jchrest.architecture

Class Stm

  • java.lang.Object
    • jchrest.architecture.Stm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Node>

    public class Stm
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Node>
    Represents the short-term memory for a Modality of a Chrest model, i.e. a place where pointers to Nodes in long-term memory are stored (input to long-term memory should be stored in structures akin to, for example, phonological loops for verbal input; not yet present in the CHREST architecture). Stm is, essentially, a finite-sized FIFO List however, it is actually a pseudo FIFO List since the pointer to the most informative Node (the hypothesis) is always retained in the first index of the list (unless the Stm is "manually" cleared). So, if a Node is added to a Stm, causing the size of the Stm to exceed its maximum capacity, the Nodes in the elements of the List that are greater than the Stm's maximum capacity are removed. However, if during this truncation process, the most informative Node is removed, it is re-added as the first element in the List (and the List is again truncated to its maximum capacity).

    • Method Detail

      • replaceHypothesis

        public boolean replaceHypothesis(Node replacement,
                                 int time)
        At the time specified, replace the Node reference at the "top" of this #this (the hypothesis) with the reference of the Node passed.
        Parameters:
        replacement -
        time -
        Returns:
        A Boolean that indicates whether the hypothesis in this #this was successfully replaced. The hypothesis will be replaced and Boolean.TRUE is returned if:
        1. This #this exists at the time the hypothesis is to be replaced.
        2. The number of Node references in this #this is greater than 0 at the time the hypothesis is to be replaced.
        If either of the conditions above are not true, the hypothesis is not replaced and Boolean.FALSE is returned.

      • setCapacity

        public boolean setCapacity(int newCapacity,
                           int time)
        Set the maximum capacity of #this to the value stipulated at the time specified if #this was created on or after the time specified and setting a new capacity would not rewrite #this's history. When the capacity is changed, the contents of this #this is cleared at the time specified.
        Parameters:
        newCapacity -
        time -
        Returns:
        Boolean.TRUE if this #this exists at the time this function is requested, Boolean.FALSE if not.

        Returns:
